result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristen A Ramme was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristen A Ramme is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristen A Ramme was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall receive credit for 23 days if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.
Defendant shall continue with AODA and any recommendations.  Def shall follow all rules and recommendations of DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristen A Ramme

records.addlTxt: 2:03 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Atty Martin J. Lipske appears via Zoom video/audio as does def.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def understands charges and penalties.  Atty Gross states agreement.  PLQ filed.  Def admits signing.  She is satisfied with rep of Atty LipskeGross.  Def is okay with appearing via Zoom.  Court questions def further.  Court explains what a withheld sentence means.   Court also explains that def cannot possess firearms, cannot vote until right restored and cannot possess/wear body armor.  Def understands.  Marsy's Law has been complied with.  No further questions from any party.  Per Atty Lipske, def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waives rights.  Court is satisfied def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waives rights.  DA moves to dismiss Counts 2 & 3.  Granted by Court.  Def pleads NC to Count 1.  Parties stip to FB in complaint.  Court accepts plea and finds def guilty.   Atty Lipske addresses Court before sentencing.  Def addresses Court.  Court orders as follows:  Sentence withheld/2 years Probation, Def to continue with AODA and follow up and must abide by rules of DOC.  $443.50 incl to be paid during probation.  DNA sample to be given.  Def to report to DOC within 48 hours and to pay financial obligations during probation.  ARIPR to be filed.  Bond to be applied to obligations.  Adj.  2:21 p.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:32 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def and Atty appear via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of WI.  STC hearing today.  DA:  Believes plea worked out.  Need PLEAS hrg.  June 14 at 2:00 p.m.  Adj.  9:34 a.m.  klr
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
11:16 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears via Zoom.  Atty Lipske phoned in to COC office.  Case to be rescheduled.  Adj.  11:17 a.m.  klr
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:05 AM Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video means for Defendant Kristen A Ramme. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristen A Ramme appeared by video means.  Court calls case.  Info received by def, waives reading.  Pleads NG.  Case to be set for a STC.  Atty Lipske requests case to be scheduled in a month-mid April.  April 13 at 11:00 for STC.  Bond continues.  Adj.  10:08 a.m.  klr  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 09:39 AM Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video means for Defendant Kristen A Ramme. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristen A Ramme in court.  Sgt. Randall sworn in, direct by DA.  Officer identifies def.  Cross by Atty Lipske at 9:45 a.m.  9:49 a.m.  Court questions Sgt. Randall.  DA argues for bindover.  Atty Lipske argues against bindover.  9:52 a.m.  Court find PC and binds def over for trial.  ARGN to be set at future date.  Atty Lipske would like to be heard on bond.  Did follow up on warrant in Ashland.  Indicates Ashland does not want to pick up def on warrant per Atty Lipske.  Is trying to get bond hrg in Ashland.  Requests bond reduction of $300 cash.  DA would like more info.  Court concerned re warrant.  Not modifying bond at this time.  ARGN to be set for 3/8 at 11:00 a.m.  If motion filed, can be heard earlier.  Adj.  9:59 a.m.  klr  Arraignment scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:22 AM Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video means for Defendant Kristen A Ramme. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristen A Ramme appeared by video means.  Court cites appearances.  Court provides background.  Comp recieved and reviewed with client, waives reading, pleads NG to Count 2, would like a PTC ASAP to see if need prelim.  If released on bond, will waive T/L for prelim.  DA waives notice for motion on bond modification.  Atty Lipske represents def in Ashland County case.  Court reluctant to modify bond at this time.  Would ask State to look into status of warrant.  Atty Lipske argues that if he is released from here, Ashland could come get her.  Court denies motion at this time.  Prelim within time limits.  Feb 10 at 9:30 a.m.  Court will hear motion before that if has more info.  Adj.  9:30 a.m.  klr

RAMME, KRISTIN:  1/18 10:55 a.m.   PC/bond hearing minutes:  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Right to atty explained.  Def understands.  PC statement filed.  Officer Mike Randall sworn in by Court.  Direct by Court.  Court finds sufficient PC.  DA requests $2,000 cash bond.  DA assures can readdress in couple days.  Court questions def.  Def lives in Ashland.  Ashland County warrant.  Court sets bond as requested.  Bail can be reheard.  No use or possession of any alc or drugs including prescription without valid prescription for self.  Bail jumping is explained.  Def advised to contact public def.  DA requests no use or possession of controlled substances.  Initial appearance to be set for 1/31 at 9:00 a.m.  Comp to be filed prior to that date.  Adj.  11:02 a.m.  klr
